channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Summer doldrums are slowing stock trading — but don’t sell a dull market short
item.description: Declining volume doesn’t necessarily mean lower share prices.

item.title: Shipping activity to the U.S. from China just flashed a hopeful sign for the stock market
item.description: Summer is a crucial transport time for retailers ahead of back-to-school season and the holidays.

item.title: ‘The market is as clueless as the Fed’: Why this trader says stocks could continue to do well for months

item.title: The L.A. protests over immigration raids could actually help Trump pass his megabill. Here’s how.
item.description: Polls show more support for the president’s immigration policy than his policies on the economy or inflation.

item.title: Oxipital AI and Schmalz extend partnership for automated picking
item.description: Oxipital AI said its vision and Schmalz's grippers will enable consistent production for food and beverage customers. The post Oxipital AI and Schmalz...

item.title: My daughter will be on Medicaid for life. Can my wife and I invest in the stock market?
item.description: Consider a special-needs trust, in addition to other safeguards.

item.title: HEBI Robotics gets SBIR grant to develop hardware for hazardous environments

item.title: Like humans, AI is forcing institutions to rethink their purpose
item.description: Like people undergoing cognitive migration, institutions must reassess what they were made for in this age of AI.

item.title: Agent-based computing is outgrowing the web as we know it
item.description: AI agents are moving from passive assistants to active participants. Today, we ask them to do. Tomorrow, we’ll authorize them to act.

item.title: Wandercraft unveils Calvin, new industrial humanoid, and Renault partnership

item.title: Voice AI that actually converts: New TTS model boosts sales 15% for major brands
item.description: A new spoken language model can quickly generate “infinite” new voices of varying genders, ages, demographics, based on a simple text prompt.
